chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant John M Mobley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
Comply with the sex offender registry,   
Sex offender treatment, 
No use of the Internet or possession of any hardware, software or electronic devices capable of downloading software without agent approval,  
No email address and no passwords without agent approval, 
No unsupervised contact with anyone under the age of 18 without prior agent approval,  
Enter into & successfully complete any assessments, evaluations or treatment programs or directed by the agent, 
Pay supervision fees.
ALL FINE/COSTS PAID IN FULL FROM BOND

Defendant John M Mobley in court with attorney Ronald Duane Haacke.  Defendant John M Mobley in custody.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PLQ and Exhibit 1 filed w/NC plea.  DA Parker makes recommendation prison/extended supervision.  Court reviews rights, charges,& penalties w/DE.  Court swears in DE (to clarify previous answers).  Court accepts waiver, plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty. Closing arguments.  DA Parker cites DE's history, makes recommendation as stated in Ex. 1 attached to PLQ.  DE apologizes to the Court.  Court follows recommendation, Appeal, Voting Rights & WEDS given to DE.
Pre-trial conference on July 28, 2016 at 08:45 am.
Set for pretrial with other matters.
Ronald Haacke
New criminal complaint was filed today, 16CF149.  Defendant qualifies for Public Defender.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John M Mobley in court.  Catharine Denise White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant indicated he spoke with 4 attorney's who want retainers of at least $10,000.00.  Defendant wants a dean hearing but has not completed any paperwork.  Review hearing scheduled for June 20, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing Notice - hand delivered in courtroom

Defendant John M Mobley in court.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel had withdrawn.  Remarks by defendant regarding his attempt to retain counsel.  Jury trial will come off the calendar after the review date.  Set review date to see if counsel has been retained.  Remarks by Atty. Parker regarding scheduling of the jury trial and requests jury trial come off calendar now.  Court admonishes the defendant to call the counsel tomorrow and continue to work at getting counsel.  Bond continues.  Review hearing scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant John M Mobley in court with attorney Ronald K Colwell.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Remarks by Atty. Colwell.  Remarks by Atty. Parker, recited list of items that can be returned to the defendant per prior hearing.  Remarks by Atty. Colwell regarding the defendant's need for the truck.  State's position has not changed.  Court will not release the vehicle at this point unless case law can be provided.  Discussion regarding contact with daughter.  Court is not going to modify the bond regarding the daughter.  Next dates set.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for June 15, 2016 at 08:15 am.

No contact with anyone under 18 except supervised contact and phone contact with daughter CM.  No travel outside the state without courts permission.  No internet access/devices (tablets, smart phones, etc)

Defendant John M Mobley in court with attorney Ronald K. Colwell.  Gregory A. Parker appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No resolution of the case.  Schedule FPT and JT with the Judicial Assistant.  No date set in court.  Defense had filed motion to modify the bond and also for the return of some items.  Defense requests the vehicle be returned.  DA Parker objects to this and notes the civil action filed for forfeiture in regards to the vehicle.  As far as the keys, personal property, etc DA Parker wants to check with the evidence custodian and investigating officer if the items are need for evidentiary reasons.  JT sworn in and testifies about removing a condition on the bond.  Judge will amend the condition in regards to her and her residence.  DA Parker wants to involve SS before making any amendments in regards to the visitation with defendant's daughter.   Judge will expect a stipulation regarding keys, personal items, etc.  Defense request $1000 of bond money be returned to the defendant for an independent evaluation.  Judge will allow a $1000 of bond money to be sent to defendant.  Defendant should provide a receipt for the evaluation upon 48hours of receiving the bill.  If the evaluation is less than $1,000, then he needs to pay the court back the difference.

Folder will be given to Defendant's Attorney Weerts.
